contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|Mary Jane}} '''Mary Jane''' may refer to: {{TOC right}} == People == * [[Mary J. Blige]] (born 1971), American singer-songwriter * [[Mary Jane Clark]], American author * [[Mary Jane Croft]] (1916–1999), American actress * [[Mary Jane Kelly]] (1863–1888), Jack the Ripper victim * [[Mary Jane Lamond]] (born 1960), Canadian Celtic folk musician * [[Mary Jane Peale]] (1827–1902), American painter * [[Mary Jane Phillips-Matz]] (1926–2013), American biographer * [[Mary J. Rathbun]] (1860–1943), American zoologist * Mary Jane Rathbun (1922–1999), popularly known as [[Brownie Mary]], American medical cannabis activist ==Characters== * [[Mary Jane and Sniffles]], a feature series in ''[[Looney Tunes and Merrie Melodies Comics]]'' * [[Mary Jane Watson]], love interest of Marvel Comics' ''Spider-Man'' ==Items== * [[Mary Jane (shoe)]], a type of shoe * [[Mary Jane (candy)]], a brand name of confectionery manufactured by NECCO * Mary Jane, a [[cocktail]] * Mary Jane, a slang term for [[Marijuana]], which itself is a loose translation of "Mary Jane" in Spanish ==Music== * "[[Mary Jane (All Night Long)]]", a song by Mary J. Blige * [[Mary Jane (Janis Joplin song)|"Mary Jane" (Janis Joplin song)]], a song performed by Janis Joplin * [[Mary Jane (Megadeth song)|"Mary Jane" (Megadeth song)]], a 1988 song on Megadeth's album ''So Far, So Good... So What!'' * [[Mary Jane (Pull Tiger Tail song)|"Mary Jane" (Pull Tiger Tail song)]], a song by Pull Tiger Tail * [[Mary Jane (Rick James song)|"Mary Jane" (Rick James song)]], a song on Rick James' album ''Come Get It!'' * [[Mary Jane (Scarface song)|"Mary Jane" (Scarface song)]], the second single released from Scarface's fourth album, ''The Untouchable'' * "[[Mary Jane's Last Dance]]", a song by Tom Petty and The Heartbreakers * "[[What's the New Mary Jane]]", a song written Lennon–McCartney and performed by The Beatles * "Mary Jane", a song by [[The Miracle Workers]] * "Mary Jane", a song on [[Luke Tan]]'s album ''The Suicide King'' * "Mary Jane", a song on Alanis Morissette's album ''[[Jagged Little Pill]]'' * "Mary Jane", a song on DE/VISION album ''[[Devolution]]'' * "Mary Jane", a song on IllScarlett's ''[[EPdemic]]'' and ''Clearly in Another Fine Mess'' * "Mary Jane", a song on The Click Five's album ''[[Modern Minds and Pastimes]]'' * "Mary Jane", a song on the ''[[Happy Birthday (Pete Townshend album)|Happy Birthday]]'' solo album by Pete Townshend of The Who * "Mary Jane", a song on The Spin Doctors' album ''[[Turn It Upside Down]]'' * "Mary Jane", a song on the Technohead album ''[[Headsex]]'' * "Mary Jane", a song on The Vines' album ''[[Highly Evolved]]'' * "Mary Jane", a 2009 song by Tori Amos from her album ''[[Abnormally Attracted to Sin]]'' * "Mary Jane", a song by [[Ed Kirkeby|Ted Wallace And His Campus Boys]] (Recorded in New York, March 18, 1931) * "The Thoughts of Mary Jane", a song on Nick Drake's album ''[[Five Leaves Left]]'' ==Other== * ''[[Spider-Man Loves Mary Jane]]'', a Marvel comics series * [[Maryjane (film)|''Maryjane'' (film)]], 1968 film starring Fabian * "Mary Jane", a poem by Patti Smith from her 1972 book ''[[Seventh Heaven (book)|Seventh Heaven]]'' * [[Mary Jane Girls]], a popular band from the '80s * Mary Jane Trail, a part of the [[Winter Park Resort]] ==See also== *{{lookfrom|Mary Jane}} {{given name}} {{Disambiguation}}
